name: WPFleet
context: WPFleet is a production-ready solution for hosting multiple WordPress sites using Docker, FrankenPHP, MariaDB, and Valkey (Redis-compatible cache).
The project uses bash scripts for site management, automated backups, notifications, git deployments, and quota management.
Core components: FrankenPHP (PHP server), Caddy (auto SSL), MariaDB (shared database), Valkey (object cache)
Main scripts in scripts/ directory handle site operations, monitoring, backups, and deployments
Docker Compose orchestrates all services with security isolation and resource limits
guidelines: Follow bash best practices: use shellcheck-compliant syntax
Maintain consistent error handling across scripts
Use the existing logging patterns in scripts/lib/
Docker security: maintain container isolation and resource limits
Always update documentation when adding new features
Preserve backward compatibility for existing installations
Follow the notification system patterns for user alerts

architecture.data: Runtime data (WordPress files, databases, logs, backups)
